1.text: Now I declare to you, brethren, the Good News which I preached to you, which also you accepted, in which you also stand.

2.text: And you are saved by it, that is if you hold firmly to the word which I preached to you. Otherwise, you believed in vain.

3.text: For I delivered to you, first of all, what I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

4.text: that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,

5.text: and that he appeared to Kephas, then to the Twelve.

6.text: After that, he appeared to over five hundred brethren at once, most of whom remain [alive] until now, but some have also fallen asleep.

7.text: Then he appeared to James, then to all the apostles,

8.text: and last of all, as to the child born at the wrong time, he appeared to me also.

9.text: Indeed, I am the least of the apostles, unworthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the Church of God.

10.text: But by the grace of God, I am what I am. His grace which was bestowed on me was not in vain, but I worked more than all of them—yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.

11.text: It does not matter whether is it I or they: this is what we preach, and so you believed.

12.text: Now if Christ is preached and we preach that he has been raised from the dead, how is it that some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?

13.text: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, then Christ has not been raised!

14.text: If Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is in vain, and your faith is also in vain.

15.text: Yes, we are found to be false witnesses of God, because we testified concerning God that he raised up Christ (but if God did not raise him up, then the dead are not raised).

16.text: Truly, if the dead are not raised, then Christ has not been raised!

17.text: If Christ has not been raised, your faith is vain, and you are still in your sins.

18.text: Moreover, those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.

19.text: If it is only in this life that we have hoped in Christ, we are the most pathetic of all human beings!

20.text: But in fact, Christ has been raised from the dead! He did become the first fruits of those who are asleep.

21.text: For since death came through [one] man, the resurrection of the dead also came through [one] man.

22.text: As in Adam all die, in Christ all will be made alive.

23.text: But each in the proper order: Christ (the first fruits), then those who are Christ’s at his coming.

24.text: When the end comes, he will deliver the Kingdom to the God and Father—that is, when he will have abolished all rule and all authority and power.

25.text: For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.

26.text: The last enemy that will be abolished is death.

27.text: For, “He put all things in subjection under his feet.” But when he says, “All things are put in subjection,” it is obvious that this does not include the one who subjected all things to him.

28.text: When all things have been subjected to him, then the Son will also subject himself to the one who subjected all things to him, so that God may be all in all.

29.text: Otherwise, what is the point of being baptized to be as dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why are people baptized to be on their side?

30.text: Why do we also stand in danger at every hour?

31.text: I affirm, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, that I die daily.

32.text: If I fought with animals at Ephesus for human purposes, what gain is there for me? If the dead are not raised, then “let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.”

33.text: Do not be deceived! “Evil companionships corrupt good morals.”

34.text: Wake up to righteousness and do not sin, for some have no knowledge of God. I say this to your shame.

35.text: But someone will say, “How are the dead raised?” and, “With what kind of body do they return?”

36.text: You foolish one, even what you sow is not made alive unless it dies first.

37.text: What you sow, you do not sow [in] the shape that will be, but a bare grain, maybe of wheat, or of some other kind.

38.text: But God gives it a body even as it pleased him, and to each seed a body of its own.

39.text: Not all flesh is alike: there is human [nature], animal flesh, and also [the nature] of fish and birds.

40.text: There are also heavenly bodies, and earthly bodies; but the glory of the heavenly differs from that of the earthly.

41.text: There is the glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differs from another star in glory.

42.text: This is comparable to the resurrection of the dead: something is sown in corruption but raised in incorruption.

43.text: It is sown in dishonor; it is then raised in glory. It is sown in weakness then raised in power.

44.text: It is sown as a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body just as there is a spiritual body.

45.text: And so, it is written, “The first man, Adam, became a living soul.” The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.

46.text: However, what is spiritual is not first, but what is natural, then comes what is spiritual.

47.text: The first man is from the earth, made of dust. The second man is the Lord from heaven.

48.text: As is the one made of dust, such are those who are also made of dust; and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.

49.text: As we have borne the image of those made of dust, we will also bear the image of the heavenly [man].

50.text: Now I say this, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the Kingdom of God; neither does corruption inherit incorruption.

51.text: Behold, I tell you a mystery. We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed,

52.text: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. The trumpet will sound, and the dead will be raised incorruptible, and we will be changed.

53.text: For what is corruptible must put on incorruption, and what is mortal must put on immortality.

54.text: But when the corruptible will have put on incorruption and the mortal immortality, then that which is written will come true: “Death is swallowed up in victory.”

55.text: Death, where is your sting?   Hades, where is your victory?

56.text: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.

57.text: But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ!

58.text: Therefore, my beloved brethren, be steadfast, immovable, always active in the Lord’s work, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain.
